Feature Overview‚ÄãBooking a Break, Vacation and Holidays on Your Schedule
Schedule
‚ÄãBooking a Break, Vacation and Holidays on Your Schedule
9 min read
Balance Plan
Practice Plan
Thrive Plan
Well, I guess you can‚Äôt work all the time!
If you need to block off time on your schedule, diary, or calendar, there are 2 ways to do this:
1. Using Breaks
You can use the
Break
feature to block out time in your staff calendar for activities that aren‚Äôt related to client or patient appointments. This is a quick option for scheduling a day off or blocking off parts of your day.
Some common uses for Breaks include:
Reserving a spot on your schedule for your patients without booking in an appointment (maybe the patient needs to double-check availability on their end)
Blocking off your lunch breaks
Adding non-billable meetings like staff meetings or training sessions to your schedule
Booking vacation time
Any time spent out of office
The list goes on!
2. Removing Shifts
You can remove shifts from an individual (or multiple practitioners) schedule using the
Manage Shifts feature
. This option is great if you need to book staff members‚Äô holidays or vacations.
Here‚Äôs what each option looks like in the admin schedule:
Here‚Äôs what each option looks like in your online booking site:
We‚Äôll review both options in this guide! Let‚Äôs dive in.
Information about Breaks
When a break is on your schedule, it will appear as ‚ÄúBooked‚Äù in online booking. Notes on the break are only visible in the administrative side of Jane (so they will not be visible in online booking).
For booking breaks on a smartphone, mobile device or any small screens, review this page and then see
this guide doc instead
.
Booking a Break
Click and release the ‚ÄúBreak‚Äù button at the bottom left of the schedule. It will turn blue when it‚Äôs activated.
Then, click where you want the break to start. Just clicking once will open up a ‚ÄúNew Break‚Äù panel on the right where you can set the ‚Äúend time‚Äù, or you can click and then drag on the schedule (as if you‚Äôre highlighting text) to create the length of the break in one go.  It‚Äôs okay if it‚Äôs not perfect as you‚Äôll have a chance to edit the start and end time when you release the drag.
This is what the break looks like on the schedule:
You‚Äôll also get a break edit screen to the right. Here you can adjust the start and end time using the drop downs, add a note so that there‚Äôs more info about the break, and choose whether it‚Äôs a repeating break or just a single break.
If you‚Äôre seeing this on the schedule, it means that you haven‚Äôt successfully activated the break button, and you‚Äôre still working with appointments:
Breaks on the Schedule
You can use breaks in a few different ways:
A Floating Lunch Break
While a consistent break is best managed by booking multiple shifts, if you have a lunch break that might move based on when your patients want to come in, you could use a break. These breaks can be dragged to reschedule them much like appointments.
You‚Äôre still also able to use breaks if you‚Äôd like to label your lunch breaks on your schedule, if you prefer!
Block off Part of the Day
Sometimes you want the afternoon to book up first before the morning is opened up. Here‚Äôs how that might look:
Or you‚Äôre going to the dentist:
Holidays and Vacation Time
If you or your staff are taking time off, or going on vacation and holiday, you can use the break to cover the entire shift. This is a great option for all staff with access to your schedule to know why the shift isn‚Äôt available to be booked. You can also add notes, such as who might be covering that shift or that the staff member is way of vacation.
Administrative Notes & Meetings
The final reason we sometimes use Breaks in Jane is to remind staff or practitioners of administrative tasks that need to be performed. For example, if you have a team meeting coming up, staff can pop a break into their schedule to prevent any patient or client bookings.
Then, when that staff member logs in for their day it would look like this:
This workflow can also be used if the clinic has non-billable meetings they‚Äôd like to block off time for, like staff meetings, interviewing new staff, or setting aside some time to call Jane if the clinic needs a hand with something üòâ
Deleting a Break
To delete a break on the schedule, click on it and then you will get an option to update or delete the break.  Jane will find any other break with the same start and end time and treat them as a group.
Note - you may not have created the break as a series, but Jane will look for others that are similar
Then you can delete or change just that one break or all of the ones listed.
üí°
Jane tip
: You can view deleted breaks by filtering to
Breaks
on the
Appointments Report
. To see a detailed history of changes, including which staff member modified a break, click the
blue appointment link
in the
Date
column. This opens the Appointment Panel on the right side of the page where you can scroll to the
History & Status
section.
For more info about the Appointments Report, feel free to check out this guide page:
Appointments Report
Well. These breaks play a lot of roles! I hope you find this helpful, and if you do have further questions feel free to get in touch.
Use Manage Shifts to schedule staff holidays, quickly
Jane has another way for you to quickly schedule staff holidays using the
Manage Shift feature
. Take a peek at the two scenarios below to choose the one that applies to you!
I‚Äôd like to remove multiple shifts from one practitioner‚Äôs schedule.
In this case, Jane‚Äôs
Manage Shifts
tool will get the job done faster.
Important first step: Select your staff member within your schedule view first.
Open up your
Manage Shifts
tool,
set the date range to the exact dates you‚Äôd like removed
, then be sure that there are
no shifts populating
to the left of your Manage Shifts window. If there are, simply click the
X
to remove them.
Here‚Äôs a fresh example after having removed all of my shifts to the left so that Zoey can go on holiday between
December 25th and January 1st.
I‚Äôd like to override multiple shifts from multiple practitioners‚Äô schedules.
Important first step: Hover your mouse over each staff member‚Äôs name in your schedule view whose shifts you‚Äôd like to override, and click the ‚Äú+‚Äù to the right to select multiple staff members.
Now, with the Manage Shifts window open, you can select your date range in which you‚Äôd like your shift schedules removed, select your staff members from your staff list, and remove any shifts to the left. If your shift schedule is
empty
, then
Jane will know to remove all existing shifts within the date range you‚Äôve chosen.
üí°
Note
:
Being the overprotective parents that we are, Jane would like to remind your clinic to be extra careful when selecting the date range here. Any shifts within this range will be removed so long as your shift schedule is empty.
In this example below, I am removing
ALL EXISTING SHIFTS
for Amy, Jonathan, and Zoey between
December 25th and January 1st.
üî¥
Warning:
If you see
no Shifts populated to the left
of your Manage Shifts window, and you proceed by clicking ‚Äú
Apply Shift Schedule
‚Äù, then you are
overriding your existing schedule
by
removing all existing shifts between this date range.
Jane will open a pop-up box that says, ‚Äú
Please note: if you already have shifts created, continuing will override those shifts‚Äù.

Schedule
‚ÄãBooking a Break, Vacation and Holidays on Your Schedule
9 min read
Balance Plan
Practice Plan
Thrive PlanWell, I guess you can‚Äôt work all the time!
If you need to block off time on your schedule, diary, or calendar, there are 2 ways to do this:
1. Using Breaks
You can use the
Break
feature to block out time in your staff calendar for activities that aren‚Äôt related to client or patient appointments. This is a quick option for scheduling a day off or blocking off parts of your day.
Some common uses for Breaks include:
Reserving a spot on your schedule for your patients without booking in an appointment (maybe the patient needs to double-check availability on their end)
Blocking off your lunch breaks
Adding non-billable meetings like staff meetings or training sessions to your schedule
Booking vacation time
Any time spent out of office
The list goes on!
2. Removing Shifts
You can remove shifts from an individual (or multiple practitioners) schedule using the
Manage Shifts feature
. This option is great if you need to book staff members‚Äô holidays or vacations.
Here‚Äôs what each option looks like in the admin schedule:
Here‚Äôs what each option looks like in your online booking site:
We‚Äôll review both options in this guide! Let‚Äôs dive in.
Information about Breaks
When a break is on your schedule, it will appear as ‚ÄúBooked‚Äù in online booking. Notes on the break are only visible in the administrative side of Jane (so they will not be visible in online booking).
For booking breaks on a smartphone, mobile device or any small screens, review this page and then see
this guide doc instead
.
Booking a Break
Click and release the ‚ÄúBreak‚Äù button at the bottom left of the schedule. It will turn blue when it‚Äôs activated.
Then, click where you want the break to start. Just clicking once will open up a ‚ÄúNew Break‚Äù panel on the right where you can set the ‚Äúend time‚Äù, or you can click and then drag on the schedule (as if you‚Äôre highlighting text) to create the length of the break in one go.  It‚Äôs okay if it‚Äôs not perfect as you‚Äôll have a chance to edit the start and end time when you release the drag.
This is what the break looks like on the schedule:
You‚Äôll also get a break edit screen to the right. Here you can adjust the start and end time using the drop downs, add a note so that there‚Äôs more info about the break, and choose whether it‚Äôs a repeating break or just a single break.
If you‚Äôre seeing this on the schedule, it means that you haven‚Äôt successfully activated the break button, and you‚Äôre still working with appointments:
Breaks on the Schedule
You can use breaks in a few different ways:
A Floating Lunch Break
While a consistent break is best managed by booking multiple shifts, if you have a lunch break that might move based on when your patients want to come in, you could use a break. These breaks can be dragged to reschedule them much like appointments.
You‚Äôre still also able to use breaks if you‚Äôd like to label your lunch breaks on your schedule, if you prefer!
Block off Part of the Day
Sometimes you want the afternoon to book up first before the morning is opened up. Here‚Äôs how that might look:
Or you‚Äôre going to the dentist:
Holidays and Vacation Time
If you or your staff are taking time off, or going on vacation and holiday, you can use the break to cover the entire shift. This is a great option for all staff with access to your schedule to know why the shift isn‚Äôt available to be booked. You can also add notes, such as who might be covering that shift or that the staff member is way of vacation.
Administrative Notes & Meetings
The final reason we sometimes use Breaks in Jane is to remind staff or practitioners of administrative tasks that need to be performed. For example, if you have a team meeting coming up, staff can pop a break into their schedule to prevent any patient or client bookings.
Then, when that staff member logs in for their day it would look like this:
This workflow can also be used if the clinic has non-billable meetings they‚Äôd like to block off time for, like staff meetings, interviewing new staff, or setting aside some time to call Jane if the clinic needs a hand with something üòâ
Deleting a Break
To delete a break on the schedule, click on it and then you will get an option to update or delete the break.  Jane will find any other break with the same start and end time and treat them as a group.
Note - you may not have created the break as a series, but Jane will look for others that are similar
Then you can delete or change just that one break or all of the ones listed.
üí°
Jane tip
: You can view deleted breaks by filtering to
Breaks
on the
Appointments Report
. To see a detailed history of changes, including which staff member modified a break, click the
blue appointment link
in the
Date
column. This opens the Appointment Panel on the right side of the page where you can scroll to the
History & Status
section.
For more info about the Appointments Report, feel free to check out this guide page:
Appointments Report
Well. These breaks play a lot of roles! I hope you find this helpful, and if you do have further questions feel free to get in touch.
Use Manage Shifts to schedule staff holidays, quickly
Jane has another way for you to quickly schedule staff holidays using the
Manage Shift feature
. Take a peek at the two scenarios below to choose the one that applies to you!
I‚Äôd like to remove multiple shifts from one practitioner‚Äôs schedule.
In this case, Jane‚Äôs
Manage Shifts
tool will get the job done faster.
Important first step: Select your staff member within your schedule view first.
Open up your
Manage Shifts
tool,
set the date range to the exact dates you‚Äôd like removed
, then be sure that there are
no shifts populating
to the left of your Manage Shifts window. If there are, simply click the
X
to remove them.
Here‚Äôs a fresh example after having removed all of my shifts to the left so that Zoey can go on holiday between
December 25th and January 1st.
I‚Äôd like to override multiple shifts from multiple practitioners‚Äô schedules.
Important first step: Hover your mouse over each staff member‚Äôs name in your schedule view whose shifts you‚Äôd like to override, and click the ‚Äú+‚Äù to the right to select multiple staff members.
Now, with the Manage Shifts window open, you can select your date range in which you‚Äôd like your shift schedules removed, select your staff members from your staff list, and remove any shifts to the left. If your shift schedule is
empty
, then
Jane will know to remove all existing shifts within the date range you‚Äôve chosen.
üí°
Note
:
Being the overprotective parents that we are, Jane would like to remind your clinic to be extra careful when selecting the date range here. Any shifts within this range will be removed so long as your shift schedule is empty.
In this example below, I am removing
ALL EXISTING SHIFTS
for Amy, Jonathan, and Zoey between
December 25th and January 1st.
üî¥
Warning:
If you see
no Shifts populated to the left
of your Manage Shifts window, and you proceed by clicking ‚Äú
Apply Shift Schedule
‚Äù, then you are
overriding your existing schedule
by
removing all existing shifts between this date range.
Jane will open a pop-up box that says, ‚Äú
